title: They're holding back the release of Debonair Galio because "a lot of players weren't super excited".

embed.description: Hey guys, we saw that a lot of players weren't super excited about the Debonair Galio skin on PBE, so we've decided to take some time and do what we can to make this skin as awesome possible. That said, he won't be in Patch 5.5. Flying into the Debonair line is Debonair Galio!

body: Meanwhile, nobody was excited for the Veigar changes but they locked them in and shipped them out anyway.

A skin change is different to a balance change. Think of Ahri and the uproar that surrounded her change. Without knowing how something is going to play, you can't accurately judge it. This is exacerated by the negative feeings some people get when they see a change to a champion they play. Respnses to these changes tend to be subjective.

On the other hand, a skin is something that can be analysed objectively before actually playing with it (Unless you only have a model viewer to go on - those make everything shit).

The thing about Ahri is that people underestimated how much of an impact the speed boost on Q would have, because everyone was angry over losing the 20% damage amp.  With Veigar, he just got straight nerfs. There's not really anything to be misunderstood. His stun now has a one second delay, his CDs increased, his Q's a skillshot and is thus unreliable. What's the redemption? He can get two ap with one Q? It doesn't matter when any assassin can still destroy him, since he can't stop them anymore. Tons of PBE testers told riot it was a bad idea. People wrote long rants about why the changes were actually huge nerfs. Still pushed out to Live. The quality of a skin is important enough to delay, but not changes that 90% of people don't like? They'll listen to PBE testers about a skin quality, but not actual champion balance. The important thing.

Skins make money, balance changes don't.
If they change the skin to what people want they make money.
If they make balance changes to what people want or what people don't want they don't make money.
So you're telling me that by shipping a gameplay change that don,t make money while withholding a skin that will make money. They are not greedy.
